conclusion: In a uniform electric field, the horizontal component of the electron’s velocity (vx) is unchanged because the electric force acts vertically.
The electron leaves the field making a 30° angle below the initial direction, so tan 30° = |vy| / vx.
Resultant speed at C: v = √(vx² + vy²) = v0 / cos 30° ≈ 4.62 × 10^6 m s-1.
Kinetic energy at C: K = ½ m v² = ½ (9.1 × 10^-31 kg)(4.62 × 10^6 m s-1)² ≈ 9.7 × 10^-18 J.
